intro: Notopleura angustissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf notopleura, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
